alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 9:25PM CDT until April 26 at 1:57PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam affecting Adams and Juneau Counties. .Rain and melting snow will cause rivers to continue to rise and flood. More rain will only lead to increased river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wisconsin River at Castle Rock Dam. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 40,000.0 cfs, Several roads are closed downstream of the dam. Highway Z and HH are likely closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:10 PM CDT Wednesday the flow was 32,009.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 8:10 PM CDT Wednesday was 32,622.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river will rise to 37,500.0 cfs Friday morning. It will then fall early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 37,400.0 cfs early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood flow is 30,000.0 cfs. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
